alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Northumberland; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 12:04AM EST until December 18 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central, eastern, and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in east central Virginia, King and Queen and Richmond. In eastern Virginia, Lancaster, Mathews, Middlesex and Northumberland. In southeast Virginia, Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through 3 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, West Point, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Deltaville, Robley, Fair Port, Callao, Gloucester Point, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Lancaster, White Stone, Hartfield, Saluda, Glenns, Blakes, Church View, Morattico and Wicomico Church. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
